org.xlattice.crypto

Interface Digest

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SHA1, SHA1Digest

    public interface Digest
    A Digest is something that converts a (normally larger) byte array into a second (normally smaller) byte array. The Digest is a cryptographically secure one-way hash function. The output byte array is of fixed size.
    Author:
    Jim Dixon

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] digest() 
      byte[] digest(byte[] data)
      Add data block to whatever has been seen so far and return digest of the combination.
      int length()
      The length of the byte array to be returned.
      void reset()
      Reinitialize the hash function.
      void update(byte[] data)
      Add to the data being hashed.

    • Method Detail

      • digest

        byte[] digest()
        Returns:
        the hash of the data seen so far.

      • digest

        byte[] digest(byte[] data)
        Add data block to whatever has been seen so far and return digest of the combination.

      • length

        int length()
        The length of the byte array to be returned.
        Returns:
        the size of the digest in bytes

      • reset

        void reset()
        Reinitialize the hash function. Any data passed in earlier calls to update() will be lost.

      • update

        void update(byte[] data)
        Add to the data being hashed.
        Parameters:
        data - byte array of arbitrary length
